abstract: When shopping for a new computer, what kind of graphics card will be necessary to run Microsoft’s Windows Vista?
snippet: When shopping for a new computer, what kind of graphics card will be necessary to run Microsoft’s Windows Vista?

abstract: The notion of a computer at the heart of every home gets a little bump with the multitasking Hewlett-Packard's $1,800 TouchSmart PC.
snippet: The notion of a computer at the heart of every home gets a little bump with the multitasking Hewlett-Packard's $1,800 TouchSmart PC.
lead_paragraph: The notion of a computer at the heart of every home gets a little bump with the multitasking Hewlett-Packard TouchSmart PC, unveiled at the Consumer Electronics Show this week as part of the introduction of the Windows Vista operating system from Microsoft.

headline.main: The Computer With a TV, and a Family's Virtual Bulletin Board
headline.print_headline: The Computer With a TV, and a Family’s Virtual Bulletin Board

abstract: Microsoft has so far failed to fire the imagination of the buying public since the Zune digital music player’s release last fall.
snippet: Microsoft has so far failed to fire the imagination of the buying public since the Zune digital music player’s release last fall.
lead_paragraph: Despite the Redmond, Wash., giant’s famously deep pockets and well-documented commitment to the success of its first digital music player, the Zune, Microsoft has so far failed to fire the imagination of the buying public since the player’s release last fall. I overheard a litany of disparaging remarks (“It’s kinda clunky,” for example) from would-be consumers shuffling past a Zune display at the Consumer Electronics Show yesterday.
